Sentence.sentence: When we can't actually remove the source of our fear, we tend to adapt psychologically by adopting a range of defence mechanisms, says Tom Crompton, change strategist for the environmental organisation World Wide Fund for Nature.
Remove that resistance and you are more likely to produce a 70-page ramble (不着边际的长篇大论).
If farmers like Bowman are able to use these seeds without paying the designated fee, it will remove the incentives for companies like Monsanto to innovate
Sometimes it's only when a difficulty is removed that we realise what it was doing for us.
It is impossible to remove the stain completely.

Nonetheless, the developers of the Chinatown garage are confident with the technology and are counting on it to squeeze 67 cars in an apartment-building basement that would otherwise fit only 24, accomplished by removing a maneuver space normally required.
What accounts for the failure of some websites to remove photos immediately?
Whether a deleted photo is immediately removed from the web.
Researchers at Cambridge University have found that nearly half of the social networking sites don't immediately delete pictures when a user requests they be removed
In general, photo-centric websites like Flickr were found to be better at quickly removing deleted photos upon request.
"Our philosophy with the island has always been, ‘OK, remove the threats and let the island go back to what it was, '" says ecologist Christina Boser.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: "When we can't actually remove the source of our fear, we tend to adapt psychologically by adopting a range of defence mechanisms," says Tom Crompton, change strategist for the environmental organisation World wide Fund for Nature.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"从一处移往另一处"之意。
means: move ： 普通用词，指从一处到另一外的任何距离的转移。
shift ： 侧重位置与方向的改变。
transfer ： 一般表示转送或移交迁移，尤指交通运输中的换乘或职务的调动等。
remove ： 作"移动"解时，与move可换用，还可指撤职或开除学藉等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"开除，驱出，去掉"之意。
means: remove ： 普通用词，不带任何感情色彩。
eliminate ： 通常指例行的、有步骤地去掉某物或某人。
dismiss ： 既可指突然地迅速地排除，也可指解雇或开除。
expel ： 多指强行解除公职或驱出住地。

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"回,向后,相反,不"; 2. 表示"一再,重新"

re一再,重新+surg升起,浪潮+ence表名词→重起浪潮→复兴
re回,向后,相反,不+proach接近→不接近→指责
re反+volt转→反过转→反叛
re回+call喊;想→回想
re回+flect弯曲→弯曲返回→反射
re回,向后,相反,不+linqu离开+ish表动词→离开不再要→放弃
re回,向后,相反,不+mov运动,移动+e→移开,消除
re回,向后,相反,不+pel推→击退
re反+sent感觉→反感→不满
re反+sist站→反着站→反抗
re回+tract拉→拉回,缩回
re回+treat→v.后退,撤退
re一再,重新+arrange安排→v.重新安排
re一再,重新+assure确保→v.消除某人疑虑
re一再,重新+capit头+ulate=ate表动词→重新把头拿出来→概括要点
re一再,重新+claim喊→喊回来→取回,引申为开垦荒地
re一再,重新+commend赞扬→一再赞扬
re一再,重新+furbish装饰→再装饰→刷新

re一再,重新+in入+state国家,权力→重新进入权力
re一再,重新+iterate重说→反复重说

Sentence.sentence: Even when the machines are recycled and the harmful metals removed, the recycling process often is carried out in poor countries, in practically uncontrolled ways which allow many poisonous substances to escape into the environment.

Sentence.sentence: If, one week from the date of written notice, the pet is not removed, the student is referred to the student court.

Sentence.sentence: So condors with high levels of lead are sent to Los Angeles zoo, where they are treated with calcium edta, a chemical that removes lead from the blood over several days.

Sentence.sentence: When neither of these methods removed the static noise, I would sit helplessly and wait for the noise to go away.

Sentence.sentence: We are even farther removed from the unfocused newspaper review published in England between the turn of the 20th century and the eve of World War Ⅱ, at a time when newsprint was dirt-cheap and stylish arts criticism was considered an ornament to the publications in which it appeared.

If people in the network just two degrees removed from the initial influential prove resistant,for example from the initial influential prove resistant,for example the cascade of change won’t propagate very far or affect many people.
To limit the number of telescopes on Mauna Kea, old ones will be removed at the end of their lifetimes and their sites returned to a natural state.
The recession threatened to remove the advertising and readers that had not already fled to the Internet.

Sentence.sentence: The shortage is compounded by federal immigration raids, which remove some workers and drive others underground.

entry.def: If you remove something from a place, you take it away.

example.ex: As soon as the cake is done, remove it from the oven...
example.tran: 蛋糕一烤好，立即把它从烤箱中取出。

example.ex: At least three bullets were removed from his wounds...
example.tran: 从他的伤口至少取出了3颗子弹。

entry.def: If you remove clothing, you take it off.
If you remove a stain from something, you make the stain disappear by treating it with a chemical or by washing it.

example.ex: This treatment removes the most stubborn stains...
example.tran: 这种处理方式会清除最顽固的污渍。

example.ex: Try using lemon juice to remove tobacco stains from your fingers.
example.tran: 试试用柠檬汁去除手指上的烟渍。

entry.def: If people remove someone from power or from something such as a committee, they stop them being in power or being a member of the committee.

example.ex: The student senate voted to remove Fuller from office...
example.tran: 学生评议会投票免除了富勒的职位。

example.ex: The president could only be removed from power once free elections were organised...
example.tran: 总统只有在开始自由选举时才能被免职。

entry.def: If you remove an obstacle, a restriction, or a problem, you get rid of it.
entry.tran: 消除(障碍);取消(限制);解决(问题)

example.ex: The agreement removes the last serious obstacle to the signing of the arms treaty...
example.tran: 这个协议排除了签订武器条约的最后一个严重障碍。

example.ex: Most of her fears had been removed.
example.tran: 她的恐惧基本上消除了。

entry.def: If you do or experience something at one remove, you do not do it or experience it yourself, but someone else does it or experiences it instead of you.

example.ex: She enjoyed his company and the excitement of feeling herself linked at one remove to London society...
example.tran: 她喜欢他的陪伴，也很享受离伦敦社交圈仅仅一步之遥的兴奋感觉。

example.ex: She can know the world only at several removes.
example.tran: 她只能间接地认知这个世界。

means.word_mean: 1. degree of figurative distance or separation;

sentences.sentence: "just one remove from madness" or "it imitates at many removes a Shakespearean tragedy";

means.word_mean: 1. remove something concrete, as by lifting, pushing, taking off, etc. or remove something abstract;

sentences.sentence: "Remove the dirty dishes from the table"
"This machine withdraws heat from the environment"

means.word_mean: 2. remove from a position or an office

sentences.sentence: "The company got rid of all the dead wood"
"The teacher took the children out of the classroom"

means.word_mean: 5. shift the position or location of, as for business, legal, educational, or military purposes;

sentences.sentence: "He removed his children to the countryside"
"Remove the troops to the forest surrounding the city"
"The mafia boss ordered his enemies murdered"
"The death of her mother removed the last obstacle to their marriage"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): from the Old French stem remov-, from Latin removere, from re- 'back' + movere 'to move'
